Systemwide Community Safety











            Overview
                    







            Data dashboard
                            
- current section









            Reports and Updates
                    







            Policies and Guidance
                    







            Staff
                    
















Data Dashboard


The 
UC Community Safety Plan
 calls on all UC campuses to collect and publicly share uniform campus safety data to empower the UC community and inform change. To demonstrate our commitment to transparency and continuous improvement through data, a 
Community Safety data dashboard workgroup
 commenced in Fall 2021 to meet the plan’s key milestones, including the development of a suite of systemwide dashboards on calls for service, civilian complaints, crimes, stops, UC Police Department budget and workforce, and use of force.


The dashboards developed by the workgroup and its operational partner, the 
Office of Institutional Research and Academic Planning (IRAP)
, are available through the links below. 


Please contact 
Community-Safety-Dashboards@ucop.edu
 with questions or feedback.


Budget and workforce


Each UC Police Department's budget and workforce reflect its organizational and budget model, along with ongoing transformation as needs for services change and officer assignments shift.


Calls for service


Calls for service to law enforcement agencies generally include calls to “911” for emergency assistance and may also include calls to non-emergency numbers. UC Police Departments are required to report monthly data to UCOP on civilian calls for service, noting call category (standardized acr

Systemwide Community Safety











            Overview
                            
- current section









            Data dashboard
                    







            Reports and Updates
                    







            Policies and Guidance
                    







            Staff
                    
















We promote ongoing community engagement in safety, and work with all UC locations to build a more holistic, data-driven, service-oriented and community-centric approach to safety and security across the University. 




The Office of Systemwide Community Safety engages across the university to implement practices that improve consistency, transparency and accountability and demonstrate a community-oriented approach to safety and security. This office directly supports the full implementation of the 
UC Community Safety Plan
.






 






Jody Stiger

Meet the Triton CORE Team 


The Triton CORE team is composed of licensed behavioral health professionals.
 
MORE ABOUT THE TEAM
 


























New Mobile Mental Health Crisis Team Launches at UC San Diego 


The Triton Compassionate Response team works in partnership with Campus Police to support students in crisis.

 
VIEW ARTICLE
 


























 


















Previous








Next




















 










Important Notice


The Triton CORE team's current hours of operation are 
Monday–Friday between 10am–10pm
.












About Triton CORE


Triton CORE is a mobile response team at UC San Diego that provides compassionate intervention and support to students experiencing a behavioral health crisis. The 
Triton CORE team
 is composed of licensed behavioral health professionals equipped to engage in mobile crisis response, conduct behavioral health wellness checks, and can provide in-person or telehealth assessment for students facing behavioral health cha

What is CARE at SARC?












CARE at the Sexual Assault Resource Center 
is the UC San Diego confidential advocacy and education 
office for sexual violence
 
and gender-based violence (dating violence, domestic violence, stalking).


CARE provides violence prevention education for the entire UCSD campus and offers free and confidential services for students, staff and faculty impacted by sexual assault, relationship violence and stalking.
































Get Help


CARE at SARC is on-call 24 hours a day and on weekend

Principles of Community 


We affirm the right to freedom of expression at UC San Diego. We promote open expression of our individuality and our diversity within the bounds of courtesy, sensitivity, confidentiality, and respect.
 
UC San Diego's principles & values

- current section









            Reports and Updates
                    







            Policies and Guidance
                    







            Staff
                    
















Data Dashboard


The 
UC Community Safety Plan
 calls on all UC campuses to collect and publicly share uniform campus safety data to empower the UC community and inform change. To demonstrate our commitment to transparency and continuous improvement through data, a 
Community Safety data dashboard workgroup
 commenced in Fall 2021 to meet the plan’s key milestones, including the development of a suite of systemwide dashboards on calls for service, civilian complaints, crimes, stops, UC Police Department budget and workforce, and use of force.


The dashboards developed by the workgroup and its operational partner, the 
Office of Institutional Research and Academic Planning (IRAP)
, are available through the links below. 


Please contact 
Community-Safety-Dashboards@ucop.edu
 with questions or feedback.


Budget and workforce


Each UC Police Department's budget and workforce reflect its organizational and budget model, along with ongoing transformation as needs for services change and officer assignments shift.


Calls for service


Calls for service to law enforcement agencies generally include calls to “911” for emergency assistance and may also include calls to non-emergency numbers. UC Police Departments are required to report monthly data to UCOP on civilian calls for service, noting call category (standardized acr

            Overview
                            
- current section









            Data dashboard
                    







            Reports and Updates
                    







            Policies and Guidance
                    







            Staff
                    
















We promote ongoing community engagement in safety, and work with all UC locations to build a more holistic, data-driven, service-oriented and community-centric approach to safety and security across the University. 




The Office of Systemwide Community Safety engages across the university to implement practices that improve consistency, transparency and accountability and demonstrate a community-oriented approach to safety and security. This office directly supports the full implementation of the 
UC Community Safety Plan
.






 






Jody Stiger

Meet the Triton CORE Team 


The Triton CORE team is composed of licensed behavioral health professionals.
 
MORE ABOUT THE TEAM
 


























New Mobile Mental Health Crisis Team Launches at UC San Diego 


The Triton Compassionate Response team works in partnership with Campus Police to support students in crisis.

 
VIEW ARTICLE
 


























 


















Previous








Next




















 










Important Notice


The Triton CORE team's current hours of operation are 
Monday–Friday between 10am–10pm
.












About Triton CORE


Triton CORE is a mobile response team at UC San Diego that provides compassionate intervention and support to students experiencing a behavioral health crisis. The

What is CARE at SARC?












CARE at the Sexual Assault Resource Center 
is the UC San Diego confidential advocacy and education 
office for sexual violence
 
and gender-based violence (dating violence, domestic violence, stalking).


CARE provides violence prevention education for the entire UCSD campus and offers free and confidential services for students, staff and faculty impacted by sexual assault, relationship violence and stalking.
































Get Help


CARE at SARC is on-call 24 hours a day and on weekend

Timely Warning â Burglary
Timely Warning â Burglary


UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT


February 4, 2025




ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


Timely Warning â Burglary

On February 4, 2025, at 8:03 AM, the UC San Diego Police Department received reports of two burglaries at the BCB CafÃ© Coffee Cart at Warren Mall. The first burglary occurred sometime between 2:30 PM on January 29 and 11:00 AM on January 30, 2025. The second burglary occurred sometime between 3:00 PM on February 3 and 6:55 AM on February 4, 2025. The reporting party stated that in both cases, unknown suspects gained entry into the coffee cart and stole items while the business was closed.


There is no suspect information at this time.
At this time, the suspect is/is not in custody.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.

If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or submit an online tip at 
https://police.ucsd.edu/services/anonymous.html
.   



The remainder of this message provides general information about preventing and reporting a burglary and is not necessarily related to this incident.


If you are the victim of a burglary or you discover someone inside your residence:



If possible, 
immediately leave your residence and go to a safe area
 (e.g., a neighborâs apartment or a public place).
Call or text the UC San Diego Police Department
 
at 9-1-1.
If you are unable to leave your residence, 
secure yourself and family members in a safe location, turn on all available lights, and call the police immediately.
 


To help reduce the risk of being the victim of a burglary:


Make sure doors and windows are closed and locked. 
When it is hot out, use a lock or item which only allows the window to open small distances.


If you live on campus and your windows or doors wonât lock
, please call Housing Maintenance at (858) 534-2600.

Timely Warning â Burglary


UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT


January 30, 2025






ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


Timely Warning â Burglary

On January 28, 2025, at approximately 3:45 PM, the UC San Diego Police Department received an online theft report that occurred at Muir College Residential Housing. Through investigation the theft was determined to be a burglary. The burglary happened between 9:40 AM and 10:20 AM that same day. The reporting party stated that an unknown suspect(s) took their key card holder containing their room key, student identification card, and approximately $220 from a desk in their room. There is no indication of forced entry as the reporting party left their room door open.



There is no suspect description at this time. 
At this time, the suspect is not in custody.

alert_title: 01/27/2025 Timely Warning - Sexual Assault Known Perpetrator
location_text: you can make informed decisions about your safety
description:
Timely Warning - Sexual Assault Known Perpetrator
Timely Warning - Sexual Assault Known Perpetrator


UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT


January 27, 2025






ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO



                                        
                     Content Warning:




This timely warning includes descriptions of sexual violence. This information is being shared so that you can make informed decisions about your safety. We encourage all community members to care for their needs and well-being while reading this message, especially those impacted by similar forms of violence. Contact information for campus support resources can be found at the end of this notice.



Timely Warning - Sexual Assault Known Perpetrator
On January 27, 2025, at 4:06 PM, the UC San Diego Police Department received a report of a sexual assault that occurred on January 24, 2025, at 8:00 PM at Eighth College. The assault was committed by an acquaintance of the victim who is unaffiliated with the University.




At this time, the suspect is not in custody.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.

If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or submit an online tip at 
https://police.ucsd.edu/services/anonymous.html
.  UC San Diego does not tolerate sexual assault, sexual misconduct, relationship violence or sexual harassment.



The remainder of this message provides general information about preventing and reporting a sexual assault and is not necessarily related to this incident.



Sexual assaults are never the fault of the survivor and keeping UC San Diego safe is everyoneâs responsibility.
Receive affirmative consent before engaging in sexual activity. Consent is voluntary and it must be given without coercion, force, threats, or intimidation and can be withdrawn at any time.

Perpetrators may attempt to use alcohol and/or drugs to

UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT

ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO

Thanks to the UC San Diego Campus Community for your calls and information that led to the apprehension of the burglary suspect from the timely warning sent earlier today. . Your contribution is crucial in ensuring the safety of our campus.

alert_title: 01/23/2025 Triton Alert Message - Vegetation Fire - All Clear
location_text: Via Alicante
description:
Triton Alert Message - Vegetation Fire - All Clear
Triton Alert Message - Vegetation Fire - All Clear


UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT


January 23, 2025






ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


Triton Alert Message - Vegetation Fire - All Clear

Update on Vegetation fire on Gilman Dr. at Via Alicante. The fire has been contained. There is no longer an active fire front and poses no threat to the campus. 



Roads surrounding the southern portion of the UC San Diego campus are significantly impacted by traffic detours from with the Gilman fire earlier this afternoon and these impacts are expected to last until at least 8pm. Motorists departing campus are asked to avoid Gilman Drive. La Jolla Village Drive, and Villa La Jolla Drive and use northern campus exits. Individuals arriving for evening classes, work, and events are asked to approach campus from the north if traveling by car or to use the UC San Diego Blue Line Tolley. Bus transit is significantly impacted. 



Please do not contact UCPD with for additional information. 


University of California San Diego, 9500 Gilman Drive, La Jolla, CA, 92093

alert_title: 01/16/2025 Correction to Timely Warning – Sexual Battery
location_text: you can make informed decisions about your safety
suspect_info: suspect at Pepper Canyon Living and Learning Neighborhood on 1-9-2025 at 3:00 AM.
description:
Correction to Timely Warning â Sexual Battery
Correction to Timely Warning â Sexual Battery


UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT


January 16, 2025






ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO



                                                             Content Warning:




            This timely warning includes descriptions of sexual violence. This information is being shared so that you can make informed decisions about your safety. We encourage all community members to care for their needs and well-being while reading this message, especially those impacted by similar forms of violence. Contact information for campus support resources can be found at the end of this notice.


Correction to Timely Warning â Sexual Battery

On 1-15-2025, at 9:50 PM, the UC San Diego Police Department received a report that an individual was sexually battered by a known suspect at Pepper Canyon Living and Learning Neighborhood on 1-9-2025 at 3:00 AM. The victim stated that a known person forcefully kissed them on multiple parts of their upper body and face. The suspect also touched the victim's buttocks and pubic area over their underwear. The suspect also forced contact with their pubic area onto the victim's pubic area over the victim's clothing.



The suspect identity is known.
At this time, the suspect is not in custody.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.

The remainder of this message provides general information about preventing and reporting a sexual assault and is not necessarily related to this incident.



Sexual assaults are never the fault of the survivor and keeping UC San Diego safe is everyoneâs responsibility.
Receive affirmative consent before engaging in sexual activity. Consent is voluntary and it must be given without coercion, force, threats, or intimidation and can be withdrawn at any time.

Perpetrators may attempt to use alcohol and/or drugs to facilitate a sexual assault. Alcohol or drug

Timely Warning â Burglary


UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT


January 5, 2025






ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


Timely Warning â Burglary

On January 2, 2025, the UC San Diego Police Department received a report of a suspicious person inside the Cognitive Sciences Building. Officers investigated and determined the suspect entered private offices in the building and stole property. Officers recovered the property, and that suspect was arrested for 459 PC- Burglary.



Upon reviewing video footage from public safety cameras, a second suspect (pictured below) from a second theft (both thefts occurred in the Cognitive Science Building) was seen in the hallways between 10:00 PM and 10:30 PM on December 31, 2024, carrying what appeared to be computer equipment from unknown locations inside the building. There were no victims or witnesses to confirm that any property was missing at that time. The UC San Diego Police Department has actively investigated this incident and found evidence to confirm that the person pictured entered the Cognitive Sciences Building and stole the property.



If you discover your property or University property has been taken, or you see the suspect pictured below, please notify the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357.
At this time, the suspect is not in custody.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.


If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or submit an online tip at

Timely Warning â Aggravated Assault
Timely Warning â Aggravated Assault


UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT


December 29, 2024






ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


Timely Warning â Aggravated Assault

On December 29, 2024, at 10:47 am, the UC San Diego Police Department received a report of an aggravated assault that occurred at Naga Way and Biological Grade at 10:46 am. The reporting party/victim stated that an unknown male and the victim were involved in a verbal dispute. It escalated when the suspect slapped the victimâs face and then retrieved a firearm from his vehicle and threatened the victim with it. No shots were fired. The suspect then drove away, heading south along La Jolla Shores Drive.



The suspect is described by the victim as a male adult, approx.50 years of age, balding, thin beard, and wearing a black sweatshirt and blue jeans. The suspectâs vehicle was described as a silver Jeep (See photo below).
At this time, the suspect is not in custody.

The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.



If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or submit an online tip at 
https://police.ucsd.edu/services/anonymous.html
. 



The remainder of this message provides general information about preventing and reporting an aggravated assault, and is not necessarily related to this incident.


If you are the victim of an aggravated assault:




Seek medical attention as needed. 
Report it to the UC San Diego Police Department immediately 
by calling or texting 9-1-1.


To help reduce the risk of being the victim of an aggravated assault:




Be cognizant of your personal space to allow yourself time to react.
Disengage
 when possible and get to a place of safety.
Be aware of signs and triggers of an escalating conflict
, such as:


Clenching of fists or jaw;
Sudden change in body language or tone; or

Pacing

, 
support@ucsd.edu
 or at (858) 246-4357.



 


***Previous Update***


 


UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT


November 18, 2024


ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


SUBJECT: UPDATE TO - Community Alert Bulletin â UC San Diego Campus Phone Outage


UC San Diego continues to experience outages with some telephone services.  The following are the most recent updates:


AT&T and other regional partners are working to remedy the situation.
Campus IT services staff are also on standby to minimize disruptions on campus.
While we don't anticipate significant disruptions to campus, should you need to complete a non-emergency landline call but experience a busy signal, you are encouraged to hang up and call back.

This outage is not impacting cell services or text messaging.
911 and text-to-911 services are still functioning.
Alternate phone number for Facilities Management: (858) 245-0280
Alternate phone number for Environment, Health and Safety:  (858) 281-8488
Additional updates will be provided as they become available.

Timely Warning â Micromobility Device Theft (Motor Vehicle)


UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT


October 29, 2024






ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO




Timely Warning â Micromobility Device Theft (Motor Vehicle) 

On October 29, 2024 at approximately 6:31 AM, the UC San Diego Police Department received a report of a theft of an electric scooter (micromobility device) on Russell Lane, near Gilman Drive, on the UC San Diego campus. The reporting party arrived and found the suspect depicted below in possession of the scooter. When the suspect saw the reporting party, he left the scooter and walked away from the location.


The suspect is described as a male, 40-55 years of age, light complexioned, wearing a black and gray hooded sweatshirt, black pants, dark sneakers, and a black baseball cap. The suspect was carrying a black baseball cap at the time he was seen.
At this time, the suspect is not in custody.

The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.



Numerous micromobility device thefts were reported to the UC San Diego Police Department from various areas on the campus, generally spanning the entire campus.  The person depicted below has been identified during several electric scooter thefts on campus over the past month.



He is a light complexioned male, 24 years old, 5'10", 180 lbs.
At this time, the suspect is not in custody.
The reports are currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.







If you see this subject around scooters or bicycle racks on campus, contact your UC San Diego Police Department as soon as possible, and please do not try to contact him. 



If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or submit an online tip at 
https://police.ucsd.edu/services/anonymous.html
.

Community Alert Bulletin â Robbery Off Campus

On October 29, 2024 at approximately 3:10 p.m., the San Diego Police Department received a report of a robbery that had just occurred at 8875 Villa La Jolla Drive. The reporting party stated that a male with a handgun committed a robbery at the Nordstrom Rack before fleeing south from the store.



The suspect is described as male, about 40 years old, about 5'7", thin build, short or "peach fuzz" mustache and beard, wearing a blue stripe beanie, camouflaged jacket and dark tan pants.
At this time the suspect is not in custody.
This investigation is being handled by the San Diego Police Department.



If you have information regarding this incident, please contact the San Diego Police Department at (619) 531-2000 or submit a tip through Crime Stoppers at 
https://www.sdcrimestoppers.org/
.


The remainder of this message provides general information about preventing and reporting a robbery, and is not necessarily related to this incident.



If you are a victim of a robbery:




Your personal safety is more important than money or merchandise. 
Believe the robber
 if they say they have a gun, knife or other weapon.


Try to maintain a calm demeanor. 
Donât make sudden moves or try to apprehend the suspect yourself. Concentrate on remembering a description of the suspect and when safe to do so, 
call or text the police immediately
 
at 9-1-1.
Assess the situation. 
Remember every situation is different; you are the only one who can decide the appropriate course of action.


Seek medical attention 
as required.
Consider contacting confidential campus support resources:


UC San Diego students â
 visit 
Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS)
: 
https://caps.ucsd.edu
 and (858) 534-3755.


UC San Diego facul

alert_title: 10/23/2024 UPDATE TO Timely Warning – Micromobility Device Theft (Motor Vehicle)
location_text: York Hall
description:
UPDATE TO Timely Warning â Micromobility Device Theft (Motor Vehicle)
UPDATE TO Timely Warning â Micromobility Device Theft (Motor Vehicle)


UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT


October 23, 2024






ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO




UPDATE TO Timely Warning â Micromobility Device Theft (Motor Vehicle) 

On October 23, 2024 at approximately 12:30 pm, the UC San Diego Police Department received a report from a community member of a male tampering with scooters near York Hall.  The male fled the area before officers arrived.  With the assistance from a second caller, officers located the male at Franklin Antonio Hall, where he was arrested for grand theft, resisting arrest and being under the influence of a controlled substance.  The UC San Diego Police Department thanks the community for their assistance by promptly reporting this suspicious activity.  The UC San Diego Police Department encourages you to immediately report suspicious activity or crimes in progress by calling or texting 9-1-1, but we remind you to not attempt to confront anyone committing a crime.



Emergency â 9-1-1


UC San Diego Police Non-Emergency Line â (858) 534-4357 (HELP)


 


***Original Message***


 


UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT


October 23, 2024



Between October 21 and October 22, 2024, the UC San Diego Police Department received fifteen reports of thefts of electric scooters (micromobility devices) at various locations throughout the UC San Diego campus.  This is an unusually high number of thefts for a two-day time period.  Multiple suspects are likely involved.



There is no suspect information at this time.
At this time, the suspects are not in custody.
The reports are currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.

If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or submit an online tip at 
https://police.ucsd.edu/services/anonymous.html

. 



The remainder of this message provides general information about preventing and reporting a motor vehicle theft and is not necessarily related to this incident.


If you are the victim of a motor vehicle theft
:




Call or text the UC San Diego Police Department immediately at 9-1-1 and be prepared to provide the following: 
License plate number and vehicle year, make, model, and color
;
Date, time, and location
 you last saw your vehicle;


Date and time
 you discovered your vehicle missing; and
Advise if you 
subscribe to a vehicle tracking service
, such as Lojack or OnStar.


General safety considerations to prevent a motor vehicle theft:




Always lock your vehicle
, close all windows and sunroof, and take your keys.
Never leave your vehicle running when unattended.
Park in busy, well-lit areas.
 Pick a parking spot where there is a lot of activity. Auto thieves prefer breaking into cars in isolated areas.


Alarms or anti-theft devices work.
 Thieves are usually looking for the easiest target. If your car has an alarm or other anti-theft device, it could act as a deterrent but donât make the common mistake of assumi

Notice of the 2024 UC San Diego Annual Security and Fire Safety Report


UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT


OFFICE OF ETHICS AND COMPLIANCE


September 27, 2024




ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO




Notice of the 2024 UC San Diego Annual Security and Fire Safety Report

UC San Diego is committed to providing a safe campus environment for its students, faculty and staff. In compliance with the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act, the 2024 UC San Diego Annual Security and Fire Safety Report is now available at: 
https://www.police.ucsd.edu/docs/annualclery.pdf
.



UC San Diegoâs Annual Security and Fire Safety Report provides statistics for the calendar years 2023, 2022 and 2021 for certain crimes which occurred on campus, including on-campus student housing facilities; non-campus buildings or property owned or controlled by the university and used for educational purposes and frequented by students, or owned or controlled by an officially recognized student organization; and on public property immediately adjacent to and accessible from the campus. This report also contains information pertaining to campus security; alcohol and drug policies; missing person reports; crime prevention; information on dating violence, domestic violence, sexual assault and stalking prevention and response; and procedures for timely warning notifications and emergency response and evacuation, among others. This report also includes important fire safety information and statistics concerning on-campus student housing facility fires, fire drills and fire safety education and training.



All members of the UC San Diego community are encouraged to immediately report crimes to the UC San Diego Police Department. Emergencies or situations that may pose an immediate or ongoing threat to the health and safety of our students, employees and visitors should i

UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT


September 25, 2024






ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO




Timely Warning â Micromobility Device Theft (Motor Vehicle) 
On September 25 2024 at approximately 8:22 pm, the UC San Diego Police Department received a report of a theft of an electric scooter (micromobility device) outside of the Target Store located at 3135 Matthews Lane.



A review of the public safety camera system located a suspect in connection to the theft. The suspect is a male adult wearing a black t-shirt with a small white logo on the front and a larger white design on the back. He is also wearing a black hat, jeans, and black shoes, and carrying a black backpack.








At this time, the suspect is not in custody.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.

Between January 01, 2024, and September 25, 2024, numerous micromobility device thefts were reported to the UC San Diego Police Department from various areas on the campus, generally spanning the entire campus.  Multiple suspects are likely involved. 



If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or submit an online tip at

description:
2024 Chancellorâs Dissertation Medal Recipients
























2024 Chancellorâs Dissertation Medal Recipients














































 
 
 
 
 
 
 
OFFICE OF THE CHANCELLOR


June 11, 2024


 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO (Including UC San Diego Health)


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




2024 Chancellorâs Dissertation Medal Recipients




 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


It is our pleasure to announce the 2024 Chancellorâs Dissertation Medal recipients.


 In Spring 2013, Chancellor Khosla collaborated with the Graduate and Professional Student Association to establish the Chancellorâs Dissertation Medal, a prestigious award recognizing exceptional doctoral research. Recipients of this award are chosen based upon the quality of academic research as determined by the impact of the research to the field and/or department; the insight, originality and creativity shown by the author; the effectiveness of the writing, clarity and organization of the thesis; and the soundness of the methodology and quality of the data (when applicable).


 Up to seven awards are presented annually based upon a review of faculty committees in the School of Arts and Humanities; the School of Biological Sciences including Health Sciences; Jacobs School of Engineering; the School of Physical Sciences; the School of Social Sciences, including Rady School of Management and the School of Global Policy and Strategy; the Scripps Institution of Oceanography and the Herbert Wertheim School of Public Health and Human Longevity Science.


 
2024 Chancellorâs Dissertation Medal Awardees


Herbert Wertheim School of Public Health & Human Longevity Science:
 Tuo Lin, Biostatistics and Bioinformatics
Jacobs School of Engineering:
 Bojing (Blair) Jia, Bioinformatics and Systems Biology
School of Biological Sciences:
 Amy Prichard, Molecular Biology
School of Physical Sciences:
 Brian Kha Tran

alert_title: 04/02/2024 Be on Alert for Scams Targeting International Students and Scholars
location_text: has come to our attention regarding scams targeting our university community, particularly our international students and scholars
description:
Be on Alert for Scams Targeting International Students and Scholars








































 
 
 
 
 
 
 
OFFICE OF THE VICE CHANCELLOR FOR 

STUDENT AFFAIRS AND CAMPUS LIFE



UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT




April 2, 2024


 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


ALL STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Be on Alert for Scams Targeting International Students and Scholars
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


We write to inform you of a concerning trend that has come to our attention regarding scams targeting our university community, particularly our international students and scholars. The UC San Diego Police Department, in collaboration with Global Initiatives and the International Services and Engagement Office (ISEO), has noted a rise in fraudulent activities aimed at exploiting our students' and scholars' trust and financial security. 


One prevalent scam involves individuals posing as U.S. or foreign government officials and using intimidation tactics to coerce students and scholars into providing personal information or making payments under false pretenses. It is crucial that you remain vigilant and take appropriate action if you encounter such deceptive practices. 


What to do if You are Targeted
 
If you receive a threatening call or message from someone claiming to be a government or law enforcement official, you should: 


Always safeguard your personal, password, and financial information. 
Attempt to gather contact details from the caller for verification purposes. 
Terminate the conversation immediately if you feel threatened or pressured. 


Common Scams to be Aware Of:


False claims of criminal warrants or arrests if you do not send money or provide confidential personal and banking information.
"Sextortion" schemes through social media platforms. 
Fraudulent 
tuition requests
. 
False or forged leases
 for off-campus housing. 


Tips to Recognize and Avoid Scams:


Remember that legitimate gover

ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Timely Warning â Arson




 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


On March 21, 2024, at about 5:15 p.m., the UC San Diego Police Department responded to a fire alarm at the Ridge Walk Academic Building. Upon arrival, officers located a burnt trash receptacle inside a restroom in the building. The fire appears to be intentional.
 


There is no suspect information at this time.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.


If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or send an email to 
detective@ucsd.edu
. 
 The remainder of this message provides general information about preventing and reporting an arson and is not necessarily related to this incident.




 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Report suspicious activity
 (including the use of open flame) on and around the open lands, hillsides, canyons and trails anywhere on campus or in the SIO area to the UC San Diego Police Department immediately by calling 9-1-1. 
Call the UC San Diego Police Department if you become aware of someone talking about or planning an arson.
For Fire Safety Resources
, visit 
https://blink.ucsd.edu/safety/fire/
.




 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


What is this Notice? 


This notice is being provided to you to comply with the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act. Timely Warnings are intended to prevent similar crimes and to provide information that will assist community members in protecting themselves. 


If you have any Triton Alert questions, please contact 
EH&S Emergency Management & Mission Continuity
 at 
emergency@ucsd.edu

Required Test of the UC San Diego Emergency Notification System (Triton Alert)








































 
 
 
 
 
 
 
OFFICE OF ENVIRONMENT, HEALTH AND SAFETY




March 19, 2024


 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO (Including UC San Diego Health)


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Required Test of the UC San Diego Emergency Notification System (Triton Alert)




 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


 On Tuesday March 26, 2024, UC San Diego will send a test âTRITON ALERTâ emergency notification to all ucsd.edu accounts. Students, faculty, and staff will also receive test text messages if they have provided a cell phone number for this delivery method. In an actual emergency, an email with the subject line including the phrase âTRITON ALERTâ will be sent to all ucsd.edu accounts and via text to individuals who have provided a cell phone number. Users can update their emergency contact information, including their cell phone number, by going to 
http://go.ucsd.edu/2dyFnLp
. We will also send the message via Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook. Follow us at @UCSDTritonAlert. 
 


 Triton Alert emails and text messages are delivered through the use of an outside vendor named Everbridge. The Triton Alert email will come from âTriton Alert <
noreply@everbridge.net
>". The Triton Alert text will come from 893-61, or 888777. The message may include a weblink that starts with âhttps://evb.gg/....â which will include the full Triton Alert message, since a standard text message is limited by character count. It is helpful to recognize these addresses as a message from UC San Diego.
 


Anticipating and planning for emergency response minimizes possible injuries and property damage during a campuswide emergency, and eases resumption of normal business activity. Every UC San Diego department must have an Emergency Action Plan (EAP), which provides detailed information about the evacuation pro

Tritons Belong: Addressing Antisemitism and Islamophobia








































 
 
 
 
 
 
 
OFFICE OF THE VICE CHANCELLOR â 

EQUITY, DIVERSITY, AND INCLUSION


OFFICE OF THE VICE CHANCELLOR â 

STUDENT AFFAIRS AND CAMPUS LIFE




March 13, 2024


 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO (Including UC San Diego Health)


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Tritons Belong: Addressing Antisemitism and Islamophobia




 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


In our continuing efforts to support our campus community, UC San Diego will engage in efforts to address Antisemitism and Islamophobia through two online learning opportunities through our Triton Belong series.


 Please join us on Wednesday, April 17 at 9 a.m. and again at 1 p.m. for sessions which will help us all improve our compassion and understanding of one another. You may register to attend Aprilâs Tritons Belong events through the links below:


 
Tritons Belong: Islamophobia - Addressing the Current Moment
 Wednesday, April 17, 2024 | 9 to 10 a.m.


 
Tritons Belong: Antisemitism - Addressing the Current Moment
 Wednesday, April 17, 2024 | 1 to 2 p.m.


 Closed captioning, American Sign Language, and simultaneous Spanish translation services will be provided. These online events will be recorded and posted online following the event dates.


 
Tritons Belong
 was created in response to the current experiences and concerns that have arisen since October 7, 2023. The efforts of Tritons Belong focus on understanding and compassion in challenging times. To learn more information about the initiative and upcoming engagements please visit our 
Tritons Belong
 webpage. You will also find resources to support understanding around these topics, and archives of our previous sessions on 
Dialoguing Across Differences in Times of Conflict
 and 
Free Speech in Times of Conflict
.

alert_title: 03/03/2024 UC San Diego Community Alert Bulletin
location_text: the areas of Sun God Lawn and Library Walk
description:
UC San Diego Community Alert Bulletin








































 
 
 
 
 
 
 
UC SAN DIEGO




March 3, 2024


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


UC San Diego Community Alert Bulletin
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
We are writing to inform you that a student organization has announced that a demonstration will take place on UC San Diegoâs campus on Wednesday afternoon, March 6, near the areas of Sun God Lawn and Library Walk. 




 Because there may be a large number of people in attendance, please consider avoiding the area and taking alternative routes. Employee supervisors and faculty are reminded that they can consider remote operations in accordance with their usual protocol.




 Beyond those in our community, a large number of non-campus affiliates may also be present. In order to maintain peace and safety, a larger-than-usual security presence will be onsite.




 In addition to increased security, safety escorts will be available beginning at 3 p.m. To request a safety escort call (858) 534-9255, or extension 4-WALK from a campus phone.




 UC San Diego unequivocally condemns antisemitism, Islamophobia and all forms of hate. As a public university, UC San Diego is required to allow access to campus and support everyoneâs right to constitutionally protected 
free speech
. 




We expect and encourage everyone to exercise their constitutional rights respectfully and peacefully. Violations of the law and university policy will not be tolerated and will be prosecuted to the fullest extent. 




We call upon all Tritons, visitors and other community members to reaffirm our commitment to embody 
UC San Diegoâs Principles of Community
 in our words, actions and how we treat one another.




 
 
 
 
 
























University of California San Diego, 9500 Gilman Drive, La Jolla, CA, 92093

On February 28, 2024, at 10:00 A.M., the UC San Diego Police Department received a report of a burglary that occurred at the School of Medicine. The reporting party stated they found the window to their office open and several computers missing.


There is no suspect information at this time.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.


If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or send an email to 
detective@ucsd.edu
.  


The remainder of this message provides general information about preventing and reporting a burglary and is not necessarily related to this incident.


If you are the victim of a burglary or you discover someone inside your residence:


If possible,
 immediately leave your residence and go to a safe area 
 (e.g., a neighborâs apartment or a public place). 
Call or text the UC San Diego Police Department at 9-1-1.
If you are unable to leave your residence,
 secure yourself and your family members in a safe location, turn on all available lights, and call the police immediately. 


To help reduce the risk of being the victim of a burglary:


Make sure doors and windows are closed and locked.
 When it is hot out, use a lock or item which only allows the window to open small distances.
If you live on campus and your windows or doors wonât lock
, please call Housing Maintenance at (858) 534-2600. 
If your office windows or doors wonât lock
, please call Facilities Management. Visit 
https://hdhfacilities.ucsd.edu/

ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Timely Warning â Weapons Law Violation
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


On Feb. 24, 2024 at 4:01 AM, the UC San Diego Police Department received a notification from our automated gunshot detection system of several gunshots on the beach at Scripps Institution of Oceanography.  Officers arrived and located 10 bullet casings in parking lot 002. The officers checked the area and did not find anyone hurt or injured. No vehicles were present either.    


 There is no suspect information at this time.
At this time, the suspect(s) is not] in custody.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.


 If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or send an email to 
detective@ucsd.edu
.  


 The remainder of this message provides general information about preventing and reporting a weapons law violation, and is not necessarily related to this incident.


 
Report suspicious activity immediately
 to the UC San Diego Police Department by calling or texting 9-1-1.
Your safety is most important.
 If you are confronted with someone who says they have a gun, knife or other weapon, believe them. 
Try to maintain a calm demeanor.
 Donât make sudden moves or try to apprehend the criminal yourself. 
Use the UC San Diego Safety Escort Program. Call (858) 534-WALK
, available daily from dusk to dawn. 
Whenever possible, 
travel well-lit, busy routes.
 Avoid walking or parking in shadowed areas. Have your keys in your hand as you approach your door.
Know the location of 
Campus Emergency Telephones

On December 20, 2023 at 4:43 A.M., the UC San Diego Police Department received a report of an attempted burglary that occurred at Mesa Verde Hall on December 19, 2023 at 7:40 A.M. At this time, the suspect is not in custody.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.

Content Warning:
 
This timely warning includes descriptions of sexual violence. This information is being shared so that you can make informed decisions about your safety. We encourage all community members to care for their needs and well-being while reading this message, especially those impacted by similar forms of violence. Contact information for campus support resources can be found at the end of this notice.
 


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Timely Warning â Stalking and Sexual Assault â ARREST MADE
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


Between 11/08/2023 and 11/21/2023, the UC San Diego Police Department received several reports of aggressive, criminal behavior by a male suspect in various locations on the UC San Diego campus.  Early reports included battery while the most recent reports included acts of sexual battery and stalking.  On 11/21/2023, UC San Diego Police arrested a suspect in connection with these cases.
 


The suspect was described by the reporting parties as a male in his late teens or 20s, approximately 5'5"-6â tall, with curly, black hair and dark colored eyes.  Clothing descriptions have varied in the separate incidents. 
The suspect was arrested and booked into jail.
These incidents are currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.
 


 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


If you have any information about this incident or to report a similar incident, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or send an email to 
detective@ucsd.edu
. UC San Diego does not tolerate sexual assault, sexual misconduct, relationship

Timely Warning -  Sexual Battery Unknown Perpetrator
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


On 11-20-2023, at 8:47 am, the UC San Diego Police Department received an online report that an individual was sexually battered by an unknown suspect at Center Hall on 11-17-2023 at 3:50 pm. The reporting party stated that an unknown person grabbed the victim's buttocks over their clothing while they were walking down the stairwell. The victim elbowed the suspect in the face and possibly broke his nose. 
 


The suspect was described as a man with black hair wearing a hoodie.
 At this time, the suspect is not in custody.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.
If you have any information about this incident or to report a similar incident, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or send an email to 
detective@ucsd.edu
. UC San Diego does not tolerate sexual assault, sexual misconduct, relationship violence, or sexual harassment.

UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT




November 10, 2023


 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Timely Warning â Arson




 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


On November 10, 2023, at 12:43 p.m., the UC San Diego Police Department received a fire alarm activation at Mesa Nueva Housing. Upon arrival, officers found burnt material next to the trash chute that had already been extinguished. 
 


There is no suspect information at this time.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.


If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or send an email to 
detective@ucsd.edu
. 
 The remainder of this message provides general information about preventing and reporting an arson and is not necessarily related to this incident.




 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Report suspicious activity
 (including the use of open flame) on and around the open lands, hillsides, canyons and trails anywhere on campus or in the SIO area to the UC San Diego Police Department immediately by calling 9-1-1. 
Call the UC San Diego Police Department if you become aware of someone talking about or planning an arson.
For Fire Safety Resources
, visit 
https://blink.ucsd.edu/safety/fire/
.




 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


What is this Notice? 


This notice is being provided to you to comply with the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act. Timely Warnings are intended to prevent similar crimes and to provide information that will assist community members in protecting themselves. 


If you have any Triton Alert questions, please contact 
EH&S Emergency Management & Mission Continuity
 at 
emergency@ucsd.edu

The reporting party stated that an unknown person grabbed the buttocks of a female resident, over her clothes, while she was getting clothes out of one of the dryers. 


The face of the suspect was not seen the suspect is described by the reporting party as a tall, light-skinned individual, possibly male, wearing a gray hoodie and sweatpants.
At this time, the suspect is not in custody.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.


If you have any information about this incident or to report a similar incident, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or send an email to 
detective@ucsd.edu
. UC San Diego does not tolerate sexual assault, sexual misconduct, relationship violence, or sexual harassment.

UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT 


OFFICE OF ETHICS AND COMPLIANCE 


September 27, 2023


 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO (Including UC San Diego Health)


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Notice of the 2023 UC San Diego Annual Security and Fire Safety Report




 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


UC San Diego is committed to providing a safe campus environment for its students, faculty and staff. In compliance with the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act, the 2023 UC San Diego Annual Security and Fire Safety Report is now available at: 
https://www.police.ucsd.edu/docs/annualclery.pdf
.


 UC San Diegoâs Annual Security and Fire Safety Report provides statistics for the calendar years 2022, 2021 and 2020 for certain crimes which occurred on campus, including on-campus student housing facilities; non-campus buildings or property owned or controlled by the university and used for educational purposes and frequented by students, or owned or controlled by an officially recognized student organization; and on public property immediately adjacent to and accessible from the campus. This report also contains information pertaining to campus security; alcohol and drug policies; missing person reports; crime prevention; information on dating violence, domestic violence, sexual assault and stalking prevention and response; and procedures for timely warning notifications and emergency response and evacuation, among others. This report also includes important fire safety information and statistics concerning on-campus student housing facility fires, fire drills and fire safety education and training.


 All members of the UC San Diego community are encouraged to immediately report crimes to the UC San Diego Police Department. Emergencies or

Timely Warning - Burglary








































 
 
 
 
 
 
 
UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT




August 17, 2023


 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Timely Warning - Burglary
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


On August 17, 2023, at 9:06 P.M., the UC San Diego Police Department received a report of a burglary that occurred at Mesa Nueva between 7:30 PM and 9:00 PM. The victim stated that an unknown suspect bent the screen to an open bedroom window and stole a backpack containing multiple items. The victim does not know if the suspect entered the apartment, or just reached through the window to steal the backpack. 


There is no suspect information at this time.
At this time, the suspect is/is not in custody.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department
If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or send an email to 
detective@ucsd.edu
.


The remainder of this message provides general information about preventing and reporting a burglary and is not necessarily related to this incident.


If you are the victim of a burglary or you discover someone inside your residence:




If possible, 
immediately leave your residence and go to a safe area 
(e.g., a neighborâs apartment or a public place).
Call or text the UC San Diego Police Department at 9-1-1.
If you are unable to leave your residence, 
secure yourself and your family members in a safe location, turn on all available lights, and call the police immediately. 
 
To help reduce the risk of being the victim of a burglary:




Make sure doors and windows are closed and locked. 
When it is hot out, use a lock or item which only allows the window to open small distances.
If you live on campus and your windows or doors wonât lock
, please call Housing Maintenance at (858)

On August 17, 2023, at 6:28 P.M., the UC San Diego Police Department received a report of a burglary that occurred at Pepper Canyon Apartments. ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


Community Alert Bulletin - Unlawful Entry in Residential Areas
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
In addition to the incidents described in Timely Warnings sent for burglaries over the past few weeks, the UC San Diego Police Department has received several other reports of unlawful entries into residential spaces around campus. Many of these incidents occurred because residents did not lock their doors. In two of these cases:


One suspect was arrested for trespassing.


A reporting party described the suspect as a male, approximately 5'6" with a "buzz cut" hair style. He was wearing a white shirt with blue and/or red stripes.
The UC San Diego Police Department would like to remind all residents to lock doors and windows, including sliding doors, when leaving your residence to help reduce these types of incidents.

alert_title: 07/12/2023 UPDATE - ARREST MADE in Timely Warning – Burglary sent 07/05/2023
location_text: after an extensive national search, Karen Biestman will join UC San Diego as our Assistant Vice Chancellor for Student Equity and Inclusion on August 1, 2023
description:
Appointment of Assistant Vice Chancellor for Student Equity and Inclusion








































 
 
 
 
 
 
 
OFFICE OF THE VICE CHANCELLOR FOR EQUITY, DIVERSITY, AND INCLUSION




July 12, 2023


 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO (Including UC San Diego Health)


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Appointment of Assistant Vice Chancellor for Student Equity and Inclusion




 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


I am pleased to announce that after an extensive national search, Karen Biestman will join UC San Diego as our Assistant Vice Chancellor for Student Equity and Inclusion on August 1, 2023. Karen has more than 30 years of experience in higher education in a variety of leadership, EDI, and teaching positions. She joins us from Stanford University, where she serves as Associate Dean and Director of the Native American Cultural Center and teaches Native American Studies in the Center for Comparative Studies in Race and Ethnicity. She received both her Bachelor of Arts and Juris Doctor degrees from UC Berkeley.


Karen began teaching at UC Berkeley in 1983, and her teaching areas include Federal Indian Law, Nation Building, American Indian Religious Freedom, Decolonizing Methodologies, and Peacemaking. She has held teaching appointments at both Berkeley and Stanford Law Schools, as well as the Stanford Design School where she taught courses on Crafting Challenging Conversations and Peacemaking through a cultural lens. Karen previously served as Director of Indian Education for the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Region IX, in San Francisco, where she developed a national curriculum on Working Effectively with Tribal Governments. While at UC Berkeley, she also served as the Assistant Dean of Students. In this role, she had as many as 50 supervisees, managed a seven-figure budget, and oversaw student affairs units and centers.


As a founding faculty member and board member of UC

UPDATE - Timely Warning - Attempted Burglary sent 07/05/2023








































 
 
 
 
 
 
 
UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT




July 7, 2023


 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




UPDATE - Timely Warning - Attempted Burglary sent 07/05/2023
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


On 07/05/2023, the UC San Diego Police Department was able to confirm that the incident reported as an attempted burglary on 07/04/2023 was not an attempted burglary. The person reported to be breaking into an apartment was a resident of the building and trying to gain access to their own apartment after being locked out. The UC San Diego Police Department is no longer investigating this incident as an attempted burglary and there are no suspects outstanding.


*** Original Timely Warning ***
 


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
On 07-04-2023 at 11:38 pm the UC San Diego Police Department received a report of an attempted burglary that occurred at 3867 Miramar Street â Mesa Nueva Artesa at approximately 11:33 pm. The reporting party stated that they saw a male pulling on a first-floor window, followed by the sound of breaking glass. The reporting party left the area and called the police. During the investigation, it was determined that the suspect broke the window but did not make entry into the apartment.


The suspect is described by the reporting party as a male wearing a dark baseball hat, dark t-shirt, and possibly wearing tan shorts, with a thin build and approximately 5'05 to 6'0 tall.
At this time the suspect is not in custody.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.
If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or send an email to 
detective@ucsd.edu
.

On 06-07-2023 at 4:51 am, the UC San Diego Police Department received a report of an arson that occurred at MTS Bus stop located at Villa La Jolla Drive and the entrance to the VA Hospital. The reporting party stated that there was a small fire inside a container at the bus stop. UCSD Police Officers along with the San Diego Fire Department arrived and extinguished the flames. During the investigation, it appeared as if other items had been set on fire. There is minor discoloration damage to the bus bench.


The suspect is described by a witness as a male without a shirt (no further details).


At this time, the suspect is not in custody.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.

detective@ucsd.edu
.

For Fire Safety Resources
, visit

On 05/02/2023 the UC San Diego Police Department received a report of a robbery that occurred on the Central Campus Trolley platform.  The incident occurred this morning at 11:00 a.m. but was not reported until 4:30 p.m. to the UC San Diego Police Department.  The victim stated a male subject attacked him as he exited the trolley.  The suspect swung his arms, striking the victim in the face and causing the victim to fall to the ground.  The suspect then took the victimâs micro-mobility scooter, exited the trolley platform, and fled the area eastbound toward the Matthews Apartments.  
 The suspect is described as a male, 35-40 years old, 5â8 in height, medium build, black hair, brown eyes, and wearing a blue hooded sweatshirt.  The suspect was also described as having an abscess over his right eyebrow. There is no further description on the suspect. 
 


The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.
If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or send an email to 
detective@ucsd.edu
.  


The remainder of this message provides general information about preventing and reporting a robbery and is not necessarily related to this incident.

Your personal safety is more important than money or merchandise.

 if they say they have a gun, knife or other weapon.

 Donât make sudden moves or try to apprehend the suspect yourself. Concentrate on remembering a description of the suspect and when safe to do so,

Content Warning:


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
This timely warning includes descriptions of stalking. This information is being shared so that you can make informed decisions about your safety. We encourage all community members to care for their needs and well-being while reading this message, especially those impacted by similar forms of violence. Contact information for campus support resources can be found at the end of this notice.


 
 
 
 


































 
 
 
 
 
 
 
On Saturday, 03/18/2023, at approximately 2:49 pm, two women reported to the UC San Diego Police Department (UCSD PD) that a male was stopped in his vehicle in the vicinity of Biological Grade, at the Scripps Institution of Oceanography.  He was sitting naked in his vehicle and masturbating in public.  Officers responded and found the vehicle with the male inside.  He was detained and the two women were able to positively identify the male being detained by UCSD PD.  



This suspect was determined to be the same person and the same vehicle reported from a previous Community Alert Bulletin on 06/13/2022 and updated on 01/19/2023 (the original bulletin and update are listed below).  The suspect has been arrested and charged with two counts of indecent exposure.



The UC San Diego Police Department would like to thank the community for their help in identifying this suspect, and promptly reporting to the police department.

Timely Warning â Attempted Strong-arm Robbery
















































 
 
 
 
 
 
 
UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT




October 11, 2022


 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Timely Warning â Attempted Strong-arm Robbery
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


On October 11, 2022 at 9:10 pm, the UC San Diego Police Department received a report of an attempted strong-arm robbery that occurred at the ground level of the UC Health Trolley Stop on the main UC San Diego Campus at 8:50 pm. The victim stated that the suspect approached and demanded the victim's watch, backpack and skateboard.  The victim was able to ride away from the area on his skateboard without any injury or loss of property.


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




The suspect is described by the victim as male, 27 to 30 years of age, 5'10" to 5'11" tall, thin build, facial hair or a tattoo on his chin, tattoos on both arms, chest and hip bones.  The suspect was shirtless, wearing blue jeans and unknown shoes. The suspect was not carrying anything and no weapons were mentioned or seen.
At this time, the suspect is not in custody.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or send an email to 
detective@ucsd.edu
.  
 The remainder of this message provides general information about preventing and reporting a robbery, and is not necessarily related to this incident.
 
If you are a victim of a robbery:


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Your personal safety is more important than money or merchandise.

Community Alert Bulletin - Anonymous Phone Threats








































 
 
 
 
 
 
 
UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT




October 11, 2022


 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Community Alert Bulletin - Anonymous Phone Threats
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


On October 11, 2022 at 10:33 am, the UC San Diego Police Department received a report of an anonymous phone threat on a University Libraries phone line that occurred five minutes prior. The reporting party stated that the caller was upset with the service she received and made threats involving a weapon over the phone to library staff. 


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




The reporting party believed the anonymous caller was female  There is no other suspect information at this time.
At this time, the suspect is not in custody.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or send an email to 
detective@ucsd.edu
.  
 The remainder of this message provides general information about preventing and reporting a weapons law violation, and is not necessarily related to this incident.


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Report suspicious activity immediately
 to the UC San Diego Police Department by calling 9-1-1.
Your safety is most important.
 If you are confronted with someone who says they have a gun, knife or other weapon, believe them. 
Try to maintain a calm demeanor.
 Donât make sudden moves or try to apprehend the criminal yourself. 
Use the UC San Diego Safety Escort Program. Call (858) 534-WALK
, available daily from dusk to dawn. 
Whenever possible, 
travel well-lit, busy routes
. Avoid walking or parking in shadowed areas. Have your keys in your hand as you approach your door.
Know the location of

Timely Warning â Sexual Assault
























Timely Warning â Sexual Assault
















































 
 
 
 
 
 
 
UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT




October 4, 2022


 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


Content Warning:
 
This timely warning includes descriptions of sexual violence. This information is being shared so that you can make informed decisions about your safety. We encourage all community members to care for their needs and well-being while reading this message, especially those impacted by similar forms of violence. Contact information for campus support resources can be found at the end of this notice.
 


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Timely Warning â Sexual Assault
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


On October 4, at 1:33 am, the UC San Diego Police Department received a report that an individual was sexually battered by an unknown suspect at the Mesa Housing Pedestrian and Bike Bridge. The victim stated that an unknown male followed her across the bridge and touched her buttocks over her clothing with his hand. The victim called the police and the suspect fled the area. 


The suspect is described by the victim as male, 5'7", thin build, curly brown hair, wearing a red, white and blue striped sweater, approximately 30 years old. 
At this time, the suspect is not in custody.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.
 


 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


If you have any information about this incident or to report a similar incident, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or send an email to 
detective@ucsd.edu
. UC San Diego does not tolerate sexual assault, sexual misconduct, relationship violence or sexual harassment. 
 The remainder of this message provides general information about preventing and reporting a sexual assault and is not necessarily related to

UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT



OFFICE OF ETHICS & COMPLIANCE




September 30, 2022


 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO (including UC San Diego Health)


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Notice of the 2022 UC San Diego Annual Security and Fire Safety Report 




 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


UC San Diego is committed to providing a safe campus environment for its students, faculty and staff. In compliance with the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act, the 2022 UC San Diego Annual Security and Fire Safety Report is now available at: 
https://www.police.ucsd.edu/docs/annualclery.pdf
. 
 
 UC San Diegoâs Annual Security and Fire Safety Report provides statistics for the calendar years 2021, 2020 and 2019 for certain crimes which occurred on campus, including on-campus student housing facilities; non-campus buildings or property owned or controlled by the university and used for educational purposes and frequented by students, or owned or controlled by an officially recognized student organization; and on public property immediately adjacent to and accessible from the campus. This report also contains information pertaining to campus security; alcohol and drug policies; missing person reports; crime prevention; information on dating violence, domestic violence, sexual assault and stalking prevention and response; and procedures for timely warning notifications and emergency response and evacuation, among others. This report also includes important fire safety information and statistics concerning on-campus student housing facility fires, fire drills and fire safety education and training.

Crime Alert Bulletin
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


On September 22, 2022, at 8:50 pm, the UC San Diego Police Department received a report of an assault that occurred off campus at the entrance of the pedestrian foot bridge leading from the south sidewalk of La Jolla Village Drive, over La Jolla Village Drive (Street), to the "The Rita" Atkinson Residences.  The victim stated as she entered the ramp leading up to the pedestrian bridge from La Jolla Village Drive, the suspect approached the victim and grabbed the victimâs arm and stated "Hey, hey, hey, hey, let me talk to you. You look familiar. Come here." The victim pulled away and ran from the suspect.  No additional crimes were reported at the time of contact with the victim. 
 The suspect is described as a male, unknown age, 5'9, thin build,  unknown hair style, unknown clothing, with a shopping cart in his possession.   
 The suspect has not been apprehended and the investigation is on-going.  The crime case has been referred to the San Diego Police Department. 
 If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please contact the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or send an email to 
detective@ucsd.edu
.

Seek medical attention as needed.

UC San Diego students

Crime Alert Bulletin â Forced Entry Into Occupied Residence
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


On 09/11/2022 at 4:27 am, the UC San Diego Police Department received a report of forced entry into a residence that had just occurred at the South Mesa Apartments.  The reporting party stated that a male forced his way through the front door of the apartment, damaging the door and entered a bedroom.  When confronted, he asked for his mother.  When told she was not there, he appeared confused and then left the apartment in an unknown direction. 


The suspect is described by the reporting party as a male, about 25 years of age, 5'8" to 5'9" with a medium build.  He had short, curly blonde hair and was wearing a black t-shirt and black pants.
At this time, the suspect is not in custody.
The report is currently under investigation by the UC San Diego Police Department.
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or send an email to 
detective@ucsd.edu
.

Write down the exact words
 that were spoken or any other information that might be of value.
Do not disturb any evidence
 until law enforcement arrives.
If possible, 
get names, addresses and phone numbers
 of other victims and witnesses.
If possible, 
get a description of the suspect(s) and their vehicle
, if applicable.

Timely Warning - Arson








































 
 
 
 
 
 
 
UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT




June 12, 2022


 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Timely Warning â Arson




 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


On June 12, 2022 at 9:28 am, the UC San Diego Police Department received a report of an arson that occurred at the Leichtag Biomedical Research Building at approximately the same time.  Officers arrived on scene and met staff at the building who found and extinguished a small fire in the loading dock. There are no reported injuries and there is no suspect description at this time.
  
 The suspect has not been apprehended and the investigation is on-going.
 If you have information that could be helpful in this investigation, please call the UC San Diego Police Department at (858) 534-4357 or send an email to 
detective@ucsd.edu
. 
 The remainder of this message provides general information about preventing and reporting an arson and is not necessarily related to this incident.




 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Report suspicious activity
 (including the use of open flame) on and around the open lands, hillsides, canyons and trails anywhere on campus or in the SIO area to the UC San Diego Police Department immediately by calling 9-1-1. 
Call the UC San Diego Police Department if you become aware of someone talking about or planning an arson.
For Fire Safety Resources
, visit 
https://blink.ucsd.edu/safety/fire/




 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


What is this Notice? 
 This notice is being provided to you to comply with the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act. Timely Warnings are intended to prevent similar crimes and to provide information that will assist community members in protecting themselves. 


 
 
 
 
























University of California San Diego, 9500 Gilman Drive, La Jolla, CA, 92093

Community Alert Bulletin â Aggravated Assault *** UPDATE ***
























Community Alert Bulletin â Aggravated Assault *** UPDATE ***
















































 
 
 
 
 
 
 
UC SAN DIEGO POLICE DEPARTMENT




June 5, 2022


 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


ALL ACADEMICS, STAFF AND STUDENTS AT UC SAN DIEGO


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




Community Alert Bulletin â Aggravated Assault *** UPDATE ***
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 


The following is updated information from the San Diego Police Department (SDPD) regarding an aggravated assault that occurred on Friday, June 3rd, 2022, between approximately 4:50 a.m. and 5:00 a.m., on the sand near Kellogg Park, La Jolla Shores, 8300 Camino Del Oro, La Jolla, CA, 92037.
 
 The 59-year-old female victim, who is not affiliated with UC San Diego, was attacked from behind by an unknown male suspect.  The victim said the male tackled her from behind and âgrappledâ with her using rudimentary MMA or wrestling-style holds and pain techniques.  The victim was able to bite the suspectâs fingers and strike him one time in the face with her cane.
 
 The suspect is described as a male, approximately 25-40 years old, approximately 5â-07â, with a muscular build, short dark-colored hair that stuck out from his head.  He was last seen wearing a black sweatshirt, black sweatpants, and leather fingerless gloves.  The victim said the male had an âunusual accentâ that she could not place.  A person matching the physical and clothing description was seen near the SIO Pier before the attack.
 
 The suspect will likely have injuries to his fingers (bite marks, lacerations) and/or to his face/forehead (minor abrasion/laceration/bruise).


 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 




At this time, the suspect is not in custody.
The report is currently under investigation by the San Diego Police Department.
